A long winded way to prove you have little idea what opinions mean. It makes absolutely no difference what they are based upon. They're just opinions.
 
 
 

 ....says the one who posts from Newsmax and Drudge. Please, explain to me what a credible source is if you...oh wait, you can't. I already know that you will fail miserably, horribly and completely in meeting any challenge given to you that requires you to actually examanine a subject and post a response that has substance. 
I can recognize the difference between the presentation of FAKE DOCUMENTS and quotes of a recorded conversation. You evidently have a problem with that.
 
 
As for logic...it is quite clear that you have little.
Very few people have logic.
Duo_Maxwell

Again, your sense of logic is twisted. I asserted nothing whatsoever about everyone else. You have absolutely no idea what logic means.

 
 emoticon_rolleyes Your basic argument is that Kerry is hiding something by not signing his Form 180, and that what he is hiding is therefore his dishonorable discharge. If we apply that logic, that if you don't sign a Form 180, you are therefore hiding your dishonorable discharge, every vet who did not sign a Form 180 and was honorably discharged is hiding the fact they were dishonorable discharged. Basically the twisted logic you use is that everyone who has not signed a Form 180 was dishonorablly discharged. That is pretty basic to understand if you understand logic. 
 
 Kerry (vet) = No sign Form 180 = Hiding Dishonorably discharge
 Vets = No sign Form 180 = Hiding Dishonorably discharge
 
 

 A long winded way to prove you have little idea what opinions mean. It makes absolutely no difference what they are based upon. They're just opinions.

 
 ....long winded usually comes from facts unlike most blogs which come from the sources I have mentioned. People don't pull stuff out of thin air. The Ideas must come from somewhere, making where they are based on important. Basically you are saying a foundation of a house makes absolutely no difference. 
 
 

 I can recognize the difference between the presentation of FAKE DOCUMENTS and quotes of a recorded conversation. You evidently have a problem with that.

 
 Um, so you're saying every newsmax, worldnetdaily, and drudge you have posted has never, ever, ever strayed from a recorded conversation? And why are people who serviced typewritters in the 70s and 80s all saying that the font was around? Oh wait, the people who haven't even used a typewritter are the people who know and the people who took them apart for years obviously are off their rockers eh? isn't that how your logic works?
 
 

 Very few people have logic.

 
 You are one of them.
jim's trucking

emoticon_rolleyes Your basic argument is that Kerry is hiding something by not signing his Form 180, and that what he is hiding is therefore his dishonorable discharge. If we apply that logic, that if you don't sign a Form 180, you are therefore hiding your dishonorable discharge, every vet who did not sign a Form 180 and was honorably discharged is hiding the fact they were dishonorable discharged. Basically the twisted logic you use is that everyone who has not signed a Form 180 was dishonorablly discharged. That is pretty basic to understand if you understand logic. 
 
 Kerry (vet) = No sign Form 180 = Hiding Dishonorably discharge
 Vets = No sign Form 180 = Hiding Dishonorably discharge
Your density is amazing.
 
 My questioning of Kerry has nothing to do with other vets. Kerry is running for president based on his claims of brave and honorable duty in the Navy.
 
 His actions in Vietnam have been questioned by MANY soldiers who were actually there and witnessed his behavior. That leads me to question the truthfulness of his claims.
 
 His first Purple Heart "wound" has been questioned by many people. I'd like to see the records.
 
 His discharge has been questioned. I'd like to see the records.
 
 It is solely because he is running for president that I want irrefutable proof of his claims. This does not apply to "other vets" and your extension of my argument to "other vets" is ludicrous.
 
 Had any other vet done the same, I would ask to see all of his records, too. I have no reason to doubt the other vets. I have reason to doubt Kerry because of his own actions and his touting of his record in a bid to be my president.
 
 I have not claimed, as you say, that Kerry's discharge was dishonorable. I have questioned his claim that it was honorable. Your twisted sense of logic rides again.
 
 
 
 
 
 

 ....long winded usually comes from facts unlike most blogs which come from the sources I have mentioned. People don't pull stuff out of thin air. The Ideas must come from somewhere, making where they are based on important. Basically you are saying a foundation of a house makes absolutely no difference.
Try not to put words in my mouth with your silly paraphrasals and analogies. An opinion can be based on anything whatsoever. Agreeing with someone else's opinion is no more invalid than forming your separate opinion based on something else. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 Um, so you're saying every newsmax, worldnetdaily, and drudge you have posted has never, ever, ever strayed from a recorded conversation? And why are people who serviced typewritters in the 70s and 80s all saying that the font was around? Oh wait, the people who haven't even used a typewritter are the people who know and the people who took them apart for years obviously are off their rockers eh? isn't that how your logic works?
There you go again...extending my arguments unjustifiably. The use of fake documents and the use of recorded conversation were contrasted in one thread about one topic and you assume I give a blanket approval to everything a source presents.
 
 As I said before, your density is amazing. I believe you are using the same twisted logic as you did when you claimed that because I approved of one person breaking one law and disapproved of another person breaking a different law I held a double standard, basing your argument on the fact that the two people may have had the same underlying sentiment...that they disagreed with the particular law.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 You are one of them.
You missed the point. Nobody has  logic. One thinks logically (or not, as in your case). One may possess a sense of logic, but one does not have logic.
 
 Logic is a science, just like biology, mathmatics, physics, etc. It is no more sensible to say that I have logic than it is to say I have math. I may have a sense of  math, but I don't have  math. I may have knowledge of  physics, but I don't have  physics.
 
 Duh!
 
 Do you get that BASIC PRINCIPLE?
